content.title: Salary Reimbursement Scheme
content.department: Department of Information Technology, Electronics and Communications
content.details: The scheme 'Salary Reimbursement Scheme' is a scheme by the Department of Information Technology, Electronics and Communications, Government of Goa, for the Startups of Goa. The scheme aims to bolster startup growth by incentivizing the hiring of local talent through a dual-pronged approach. Startups can reimburse 50% of fresher salaries. The process ensures prompt disbursement post SPC approval, emphasizing that benefits are discretionary, not entitlements.
benefits: 50% of the salary of a fresher will be reimbursed, subject to a cap of ₹10,000 per month per recruit.
A startup can claim the salary of a maximum of 25 people per month for a period of 3 years.
This benefit can be availed of by 100 startups each year, which shall be selected by the SPC as per its guidelines.
For startups whose workforce comprises 60% locals, up to 25% of the salary of the local workforce, subject to a cap of ₹25,00,000 per year, will be reimbursed for 3 years.
eligibility: All the Start-ups certified by the Start-up Promotion Cell (SPC) having a valid start-up certificate number are eligible to apply for this scheme.
The employees should be hired for a period of at least 12 months.
For availing the benefit under clause 3.1, the employee/s whose salary is being claimed for reimbursement must be an IT professional/s.
The bank accounts of employees should be linked to Aadhaar.
The bank accounts of the Directors of the company should be linked to Aadhaar.
Only expenditures incurred after notification of Goa Start-up Policy 2017, being within the validity of this policy and paid for digitally will be considered for reimbursements under this scheme.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Visit the Official Website of Goa Startup Mission, verify your Email ID and Mobile Number using OTP, and follow the registration and application steps as outlined.
documents_required: Copy of Aadhaar Card of Directors
Copy of Aadhaar Card of Relevant Employees
HR Letter Certifying That Employment Contracts of Employees Fulfill Conditions Mentioned in the Policy Regarding the Period of Contract and Work Profile
Contract of Employment (Should Be of at Least 12 Months for a Technical Work Profile)
Bank Certification/bank Account Statement Showing Debit of Salary
The Form and Documents as Mentioned in Annexure 1

faqs.question: What is the maximum reimbursement cap for the Salary Reimbursement Scheme for startups hiring local talent in Goa?
faqs.answer: The maximum reimbursement cap for startups hiring local talent is ₹10,000 per month per recruit.

faqs.question: How many people can a startup claim the salary of under the Salary Reimbursement Scheme, and for what duration?
faqs.answer: A startup can claim the salary of a maximum of 25 people per month for a period of 3 years.

faqs.question: Can startups claim reimbursement for the salary of employees other than IT professionals under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, reimbursement under clause 3.1 is applicable only for IT professionals' salaries.

faqs.question: What percentage of the salary can startups with a workforce comprising 60% locals claim under the scheme, and for how many years?
faqs.answer: Startups with 60% local workforce can claim up to 25% of the salary, subject to a cap of ₹25,00,000 per year, for 3 years.

faqs.question: How many startups can avail of the benefits each year, and how are they selected?
faqs.answer: 100 startups can avail benefits each year, selected by the SPC according to its guidelines.

faqs.question: When does the disbursement of the approved amount take place after SPC approval?
faqs.answer: The approved amount is disbursed within 60 days from the date of approval.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for startups to apply for the Salary Reimbursement Scheme?
faqs.answer: Startups certified by the Start-up Promotion Cell (SPC) with a valid startup certificate number are eligible.

faqs.question: For how long should employees be hired to be eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Employees should be hired for a minimum period of 12 months to be eligible.

faqs.question: What conditions must be fulfilled regarding digital payments for expenditure to be considered for reimbursements?
faqs.answer: Expenditure must be paid digitally and within the validity of the Goa Start-up Policy 2017 to be considered for reimbursements.

faqs.question: Which bank accounts need to be linked to Aadhaar for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Both the bank accounts of employees and the directors of the company should be linked to Aadhaar.

faqs.question: Can the scheme be applied for at any time during the financial year?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant can apply at any time after incurring relevant expenditure, bi-annually/annually.

faqs.question: What is the timeline for notification of approval or rejection after submitting the application?
faqs.answer: The SPC notifies approval or rejection within 45 days from receipt of the application.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the Goa Start-up Policy 2017?
faqs.answer: The objective is to make Goa an aspirational start-up destination and build a robust start-up eco-system.
